column1: Corsicana is a city in Navarro County
column2: Texas
column3: United States. It is located on Interstate 45
column4: some 58 mi (89 km) south of downtown Dallas. The population was 23
column5: 770 at the 2010 census. It is the county seat of Navarro County.

column1: == History ==
Founded in 1848
column2: Corsicana was named by José Antonio Navarro after the Mediterranean island of Corsica
column3: the birthplace of his father. He had died when Navarro and his many siblings were young.  The first school opened shortly afterwards in 1849.Women's groups have had a strong role throughout the history of the city. They established the Corsicana Female Literary Institute
column4: a school that operated from 1857 through 1870. The first public library in Corsicana opened in 1901 by effort of the women's clubs of the city. A 1905 library matching gift by Andrew Carnegie gave the library a permanent home and its first full-time
column5: professionally trained librarian. The library today is housed in a dedicated building downtown and boasts more than 52
column10: and 122 serial subscriptions.The Corsicana Jewish community dates from 1871; they established the 1898 Moorish Revival Temple Beth-El
column11: Corsicana. Few Jewish residents live here today
column12: and the congregation sold the temple. The Historical Society has adapted the temple for use as a community center.

column1: The Corsicana YMCA was founded in 1884
column2: and has grown with patron funding. In its earliest days
column3: it was supported by George Taylor Jester (1847–1922)
column4: a wealthy dry-goods and cotton distributor
column6: and politician. He served as lieutenant governor of Texas (1895–1899)
column7: and his son Beauford H. Jester served as governor (1947–1949).Oil was accidentally discovered in June
column9: by the American Well and Prospecting Company
column10: hired by the Corsicana Water Development Company
column11: when oil seeped into an artesian well being drilled within the city limits.  In October 1895
column12: the first commercial oil well was drilled by the Corsicana Oil Development Company
column14: H.G. Damon and John Davidson. It was the first commercially significant oilfield find in Texas. A refinery was in operation by January 1899
column15: through the efforts of Joseph S. Cullinan.  The Powell oil field
column17: a few miles east of Corsicana. Rotary drilling
column19: was introduced to the oil industry by M.C. Baker and C.E. Baker
column20: with tools manufactured by the American Well and Prospecting machine shop
column23: and Charles Rittersbacker.During World War II
column24: an airman flying school called Corsicana Air Field trained thousands of pilots.

column1: == Geography ==
Corsicana is located at 32°5′33″N 96°28′10″W (32.092480
column2: −96.469407).According to the United States Census Bureau
column3: the city has a total area of 21.7 square miles (56 km2)
column4: of which 20.7 square miles (54 km2) are land and 1.0 square mile (2.6 km2) is water.

column1: Corsicana is home to the Lake Halbert dam and recreational park
column2: and is less than 15 mi (24 km) from Richland Chambers Reservoir
column3: with recreational fishing
column4: public boat ramps
column5: and 330 mi (530 km) of tree-lined and green shorelines. Richland Chambers Reservoir is the third-largest lake by surface area and the eighth-largest reservoir by water volume in Texas.

column1: === Climate ===
Corsicana has a moderate humid subtropical climate.  The range of low-high average temperatures in January
column2: April
column3: July
column4: and October is 34/55
column13: and grasses grow tall and green.  Rain is fairly evenly distributed throughout the year
column14: with small wetter peaks in May and October.

column1: == Demographics ==
As of the census of 2010
column3: 770 people
column7: 966 families were residing in the city. The population density was 1
column9: 491 housing units averaged 460.5 per square mile (177.8/km2). The racial makeup of the city was 58.1% White
column15: and 2.4% from two or more races. Hispanics or Latinos of any race were 31.1% of the population.Of the 8
column17: 28.8% had children under the age of 18 living with them in 2010
column19: 15.0% had a female householder with no husband present
column20: and 31.9% were not families. About 27.3% of all households were made up of individuals
column21: and 13.7% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.64 and the average family size was 3.21.

column1: In the city
column2: the population was distributed as 27.3% under the age of 18
column3: 12.6% from 18 to 24
column4: 26.6% from 25 to 44
column6: and 15.0% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 32 years. For every 100 females
column7: there were 94.2 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over

column1: The median income for a household in the city was $27
column3: and for a family was $33
column4: 078. Males had a median income of $27
column6: 844 for females. The per capita income for the city was $14
column7: 001. About 17.4% of families and 22.3% of the population were below the poverty line
column8: including 29.4% of those under age 18 and 15.1% of those age 65 or over.

column1: The housing stock in 2007 consisted of 12
column2: 313 houses and condominiums.  About two-thirds were owner-occupied
column3: and one-third rented.  The median price asked for vacant for-sale houses and condos in 2007 was $87
column4: 955.  The median amount of real estate property taxes paid for housing units in 2007 was $912.

column1: == Arts and entertainment ==
Today's downtown supports an active performing-arts community
column2: with year-round live theater
column3: art exhibits
column4: and music performances in a corner of downtown anchored by the Warehouse Living Arts Center and the Palace Theater. Also
column5: an art contest  was started in 2018.

column1: Downtown also features the historic State National Bank building (built in 1926)
column2: several coffeeshops and eateries
column3: an art gallery
column4: several bric-à-brac outlets
column5: and many brick-faced storefronts of historical interest.

column1: A green park a short walk from the county courthouse downtown has meandering creeks and walking
column2: jogging
column3: and biking trails. Other amenities include lighted tennis courts
column4: a children's play area with a retired fire truck
column6: and designated skate area.  At one end of the community park is the town YMCA

column1: The town has several museums: Pioneer Village
column2: located by Jester Park
column3: offers reconstructed buildings and artifacts from the early historical period of the area. A museum is dedicated to Lefty Frizzell
column4: a Nashville singer born in town during the late 1920s.

column1: The Cook Education Center
column2: located on the Navarro College campus
column3: is a multifaceted venue offering event space
column4: gift shop
column7: and Western Art gallery. The planetarium is among the largest in Texas
column8: featuring a 60-foot (18 m) dome and 200 seats. The planetarium offers narrated astronomical shows and 70 mm film for nominal admission.

column1: The center is also home to the Pearce Collections Museum
column2: which boasts a collection of Civil War memorabilia and a Western Art gallery featuring a number of renowned Western artists.  The Cook Education Center hosts the annual Navarro College Foundation fundraiser Elegance
column3: which benefits scholarship programs for Navarro College students. The Navarro College Performing Arts Department stages several musical recitals and two staged plays a year at the Dawson Auditorium on the west side of town.

column1: Cinergy Cinemas and Entertainment opened a complex in 2011 near the intersection of highways 287 and 45 containing eight theaters
column2: mini bowling
column3: a go-kart track
column4: and an arcade/game room. In 2015
column5: the location was sold to Schulman Theaters and is now branded as Schulman's Movie Bowl Grille-Corsicana.

column1: The Navarro County Exposition Center on West State Highway 22 hosts many horse shows year-round.
== Government and infrastructure ==
The Texas Youth Commission and later the Texas Department of Juvenile Justice formerly operated the Corsicana Residential Treatment Center in the city.
== Economy ==
Oil City Iron Works
column2: Inc.
column3: today a ductile and gray iron foundry
column4: was started in 1866 to make parts for the owner's cotton gin. Wolf Brand Chili
column5: a national brand named for the owner's pet wolf
column7: started in 1895 as a downtown by-the-bowl lunch wagon. Wolf Brand Chili was made in Corsicana until 1986. Corsicana is best known as the home of the Collin Street Bakery
column8: which has been making fruitcakes since 1896.

column1: Today's economy no longer relies on oil and gas. Major employers include Russell Stover Candies and Collin Street Bakery
column2: Guardian Industries (glass)
column3: Corsicana Bedding
column4: Kohl's and Home Depot distribution centers
column7: and the Texas State Home.  There are several 24/7 pharmacies
column8: grocery stores and chain department stores scattered about the town. College Park Mall is an enclosed shopping mall which primarily houses a Beall's clothing store. Additionally
column9: a  Wal-Mart Supercenter is located on the southwestern edge of the town.

column1: Corsicana was the home of Tradewest
column2: a coin-arcade and video game company founded in 1986. Tradewest was known for such Nintendo Entertainment System classics as "Double Dragon" and "Battletoads". Tradewest later became Williams Entertainment (known for the Mortal Kombat series) in 1994
column3: then Midway Home Entertainment after an acquisition from WMS Industries. The Corsicana offices were closed by Midway in late 2002.

column1: == Schools ==
Corsicana is home to Navarro College
column2: which offers associate degrees and is also a satellite facility of Texas A&M University-Commerce
column3: through which students can receive bachelor's and graduate degrees. Navarro College came to international prominence in 2020 owing to its dominant coed cheerleading team
column4: which was featured that year in a Netflix docuseries centering on the team's preparation for the NCA national championships in Daytona Beach
column5: Florida. The cheerleading squad is currently coached by Monica Aldama
column8: has led the Bulldogs to 14 championships in their division
column9: as well as 5 "Grand National" designations (for the highest overall score in competition that year).

column1: The Corsicana Independent School District (CISD) has an enrollment over 6
column2: 500 students. Five CISD schools have been lauded by the Texas Education Agency: Bowie
column3: Fannin
column4: Carroll
column5: and Navarro Elementary Schools and Drane Intermediate School all achieved Recognized status.

column1: Collins Middle School and Corsicana High School were rated Academically Acceptable by the TEA. The CISD received Academically Acceptable status from the state.
Corsicana also has one private school
column2: James L. Collins Catholic School
column3: for grades K-8. Founded in 1953 by a bequest from its namesake benefactor
column4: the school today has an enrollment of 270 students.
